resources.name: cc-sessions
resources.description: An opinionated approach to productive development with Claude Code
resources.author: toastdev

resources.name: cc-tools
resources.description: High-performance Go implementation of Claude Code hooks and utilities. Provides smart linting, testing, and statusline generation with minimal overhead.
resources.author: Josh Symonds

resources.name: ccexp
resources.description: Interactive CLI tool for discovering and managing Claude Code configuration files and slash commands with a beautiful terminal UI.
resources.author: nyatinte

resources.name: cchistory
resources.description: Like the shell history command but for your Claude Code sessions. Easily list all Bash or "Bash-mode" (`!`) commands Claude Code ran in a session for reference.
resources.author: eckardt

resources.name: Claude Code Templates
resources.description: Incredibly awesome collection of resources from every category in this list, presented with a neatly polished UI, great features like usage dashboard, analytics, and everything from slash commands to hooks to agents. An awesome companion for this awesome list.
resources.author: Daniel Avila

resources.name: claude-code-tools
resources.description: Well-crafted toolset for session continuity, featuring skills/commands to avoid compaction and recover context across sessions with cross-agent handoff between Claude Code and Codex CLI. Includes a fast Rust/Tantivy-powered full-text session search (TUI for humans, skill/CLI for agents), tmux-cli skill + command for interacting with scripts and CLI agents, and safety hooks to block dangerous commands.
resources.author: Prasad Chalasani

resources.name: claude-starter-kit
resources.description: This is a starter template repository designed to provide a complete development environment for Claude-Code with pre-configured MCP servers and tools for AI-powered development workflows. The repository is intentionally minimal, containing only configuration templates for three primary systems: Claude Code, Serena, and Task Master.
resources.author: serpro69

resources.name: ContextKit
resources.description: A systematic development framework that transforms Claude Code into a proactive development partner. Features 4-phase planning methodology, specialized quality agents, and structured workflows that help AI produce production-ready code on first try.
resources.author: Cihat Gündüz

resources.name: recall
resources.description: Full-text search your Claude Code sessions. Run `recall` in terminal, type to search, Enter to resume. Alternative to `claude --resume`.
resources.author: zippoxer

resources.name: Rulesync
resources.description: A Node.js CLI tool that automatically generates configs (rules, ignore files, MCP servers, commands, and subagents) for various AI coding agents. Rulesync can convert configs between Claude Code and other AI agents in both directions.
resources.author: dyoshikawa

resources.name: stt-mcp-server-linux
resources.description: A push-to-talk speech transcription setup for Linux using a Python MCP server. Runs locally in Docker with no external API calls. Your speech is recorded, transcribed into text, and then sent to Claude running in a Tmux session.
resources.author: marcindulak

resources.name: SuperClaude
resources.description: A versatile configuration framework that enhances Claude Code with specialized commands, cognitive personas, and development methodologies, such as "Introspection" and "Orchestration".
resources.author: SuperClaude-Org

resources.name: tweakcc
resources.description: Command-line tool to customize your Claude Code styling.
resources.author: Piebald-AI

resources.name: Vibe-Log
resources.description: Analyzes your Claude Code prompts locally (using CC), provides intelligent session analysis and actionable strategic guidance - works in the statusline and produces very pretty HTML reports as well. Easy to install and remove.
resources.author: Vibe-Log

resources.name: viwo-cli
resources.description: Run Claude Code in a Docker container with git worktrees as volume mounts to enable safer usage of `--dangerously-skip-permissions` for frictionless one-shotting prompts. Allows users to spin up multiple instances of Claude Code in the background easily with reduced permission fatigue.
resources.author: Hal Shin

resources.name: VoiceMode MCP
resources.description: VoiceMode MCP brings natural conversations to Claude Code. It supports any OpenAI API compatible voice services and installs free and open source voice services (Whisper.cpp and Kokoro-FastAPI).
resources.author: Mike Bailey
